p: A first bioactivity screening was carried out on extracts at the fixed concentration of 50 μg/mL. The obtained results ( Table 1) allowed the selection of eleven extracts, whose IA was higher than 30%, namely: Camellia sinensis Kuntze (leaves) (CCS), Ceterach officinarum D.C. (aerials parts) (COF), Cinnamomum zeylanicum Nees (barks) (CZE), Ginkgo biloba L. (leaves) (GBI), Glycyrrhiza glabra L.(roots) (GGL), Rheum officinale Baill. (rhizomes) (ROF), Rhodiola rosea L. (roots) (RRO), Ribes nigrum L. (leaves) (RNI), Salvia officinalis L. (leaves) (SOF), Tilia platyphyllos Scop. (aerial parts) (TPL) and Vitis vinifera L. (leaves) (VVI). Among them, four resulted active against both enzymes (CSI, GBI, RRO, VVI), five showed Tyr IA only (GGL, RNI, ROF, SOF, TPL), and two only Ela IA (COF, CZE).
